documents.title: YOUR EXPERTISE
documents.description:
Use this agent when you need to audit the UI codebase for internationalization (i18n) readiness and accessibility (a11y) compliance. Specifically:

<example>
Context: Developer has just completed a new feature with several UI components and wants to ensure i18n/a11y standards are met before merging.
user: "I've finished the user profile components. Can you check if they're ready for internationalization and accessible?"
assistant: "I'll use the Task tool to launch the ui-auditor agent to perform a comprehensive i18n and a11y audit of your user profile components."
<commentary>
The user is requesting an audit of UI components for i18n/a11y compliance, which is exactly what the ui-auditor agent is designed for.
</commentary>
</example>

<example>
Context: Team is preparing for a release and wants to proactively identify any i18n or a11y issues.
user: "We're planning to release next week. Let's make sure our UI is internationalization-ready and accessible."
assistant: "I'm going to use the ui-auditor agent to scan the entire codebase for i18n readiness and a11y compliance issues."
<commentary>
Proactive audit request before release - perfect use case for ui-auditor to identify issues early.
</commentary>
</example>

<example>
Context: Code review process where UI changes need validation.
user: "Please review the changes in src/components/dashboard for merge readiness"
assistant: "I'll first review the code structure, then use the ui-auditor agent to check for any i18n or a11y issues in the dashboard components."
<commentary>
During code review, the ui-auditor should be used to validate i18n/a11y compliance as part of the review process.
</commentary>
</example>

Trigger this agent when:
- New UI components have been created or modified
- Preparing for a release or deployment
- Conducting code reviews of frontend changes
- Proactively auditing the codebase for i18n/a11y compliance
- Investigating reported accessibility or internationalization issues
- Before merging feature branches with UI changes

frontMatter.name: ui-auditor
frontMatter.description:
Use this agent when you need to audit the UI codebase for internationalization (i18n) readiness and accessibility (a11y) compliance. Specifically:

<example>
Context: Developer has just completed a new feature with several UI components and wants to ensure i18n/a11y standards are met before merging.
user: "I've finished the user profile components. Can you check if they're ready for internationalization and accessible?"
assistant: "I'll use the Task tool to launch the ui-auditor agent to perform a comprehensive i18n and a11y audit of your user profile components."
<commentary>
The user is requesting an audit of UI components for i18n/a11y compliance, which is exactly what the ui-auditor agent is designed for.
</commentary>
</example>

<example>
Context: Team is preparing for a release and wants to proactively identify any i18n or a11y issues.
user: "We're planning to release next week. Let's make sure our UI is internationalization-ready and accessible."
assistant: "I'm going to use the ui-auditor agent to scan the entire codebase for i18n readiness and a11y compliance issues."
<commentary>
Proactive audit request before release - perfect use case for ui-auditor to identify issues early.
</commentary>
</example>

<example>
Context: Code review process where UI changes need validation.
user: "Please review the changes in src/components/dashboard for merge readiness"
assistant: "I'll first review the code structure, then use the ui-auditor agent to check for any i18n or a11y issues in the dashboard components."
<commentary>
During code review, the ui-auditor should be used to validate i18n/a11y compliance as part of the review process.
</commentary>
</example>

Trigger this agent when:
- New UI components have been created or modified
- Preparing for a release or deployment
- Conducting code reviews of frontend changes
- Proactively auditing the codebase for i18n/a11y compliance
- Investigating reported accessibility or internationalization issues
- Before merging feature branches with UI changes
